roleset.name: hold, support, endure
roleset.note: BEAR-V NOTES: Yes, this is really several different senses, but they all take thesame syntax. (from bear.01-v)

example.name: bear-v: endure
example.text: ...profit-taking weighed on the market, with blue-chips bearing the brunt of the selling.

example.name: bear-v: hold
example.text: ``...'' said Finis Conner, chief executive officer and founder of the firm that *trace* bears his name.

example.name: bear-v: with attribute
example.text: The new notes will bear interest at 5.5% through July 31, 1991, and thereafter at 10%.
example.arg: at 5.5% through July 31, 1991, and thereafter at 10%

example.name: bearing-n: Metaphorical burden
example.text: His bearing the burden of responsibility for his entire family's well-being had long ago began to take its toll on Jonathan.
example.arg: the burden of responsibility for his entire family's well-being

roleset.name: bear children
roleset.note: BEAR-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bear' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. Two senses, comparison to 'hold' and 'move'. (from bear.02-v predicate notes)
BIRTH-V NOTES: Frames file for 'birth' based on sentences in ULA Brown. Frame by Claire (from birth.01-v)
BIRTHING-N NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to birth.01-n. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from birthing.01-n)
BIRTH-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entries birth.01, bear.02, OntoNotes grouping birth-n senses 1& 2; no relevant mapping to VN. Framed by claire (from birth.01-n)

example.name: bear-v: durn young'uns
example.text: ``Most of them weren't even born the last time the painting was displayed publicly,'' he says.
example.arg: the last time the painting was displayed publicly

example.name: birth-v: The meaning of this instance escapes me
example.text: Yet he knew the others were sleeping more soundly, now that they had renewed their contact with the matter that-1 *T*-1 had birthed them to send them riding high vacuum.
example.arg: to send them riding high vacuum

example.name: birthing-n: Arg 1
example.text: birthing of a new idea

example.name: birth-n: NP only, Arg 1
example.text: the left-right coalition 's birth

example.name: birth-n: Arg 1 only
example.text: They got divorced after the birth of their first child.

roleset.name: move
roleset.note: BEAR-V NOTES: OK, not a great example, but you get the idea and I doubt this usagewill come up anyway. (from bear.03-v)

example.name: name the movie
example.text: "*trace* Bear left! Move the thing! And, that other thing!"

roleset.name: has relation to
roleset.note: BEAR-V NOTES: Maps to phrasal verb 'bear on' in VN. (from bear.06-v)
BEARING-N NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT-P01 nouns parts 1& 2. Maps to verb entry bear.06, which maps to VN class relate-86.2-1. No relevant fn entry. (from bearing.02-n)

example.name: bear-v: bearly there?
example.text: Now, scholars in fulfilling their responsibility do not claim the right to invade every collection of papers that [*T*-1] bears upon their topics of investigation.

example.name: have_bearing-l: arg 2 only
example.text: When are people going to realise that sexual orientation , skin colour and ethnicity has no bearing on what is inside the person and their personality .
example.arg: sexual orientation , skin colour and ethnicity
on what is inside the person adn their personality

example.name: All args
example.text: Peers including the vice president of Barnardo's debated child development in the UK, and its bearing on national wellbeing.

example.name: bear_up-v: poor John
example.text: Considering everything I've put him through, John is bearing up surprisingly well.
example.arg: Considering everything I've put him through

roleset.name: bear out: confirm? support again?
roleset.note: BEAR_OUT-V NOTES: I'm not sure what the sense is here; hopefully another example willcome along and clear things up. If you find the example, please sendit along to me. (from bear.05-v)

example.name: bear_out-v: only example so far
example.text: That was borne *trace* out by the Justice Department's decision to settle the case.
example.arg: the Justice Department's decision to settle the case

roleset.name: intensify effort, exert pressure on
roleset.note: BEAR_DOWN-V, BEARING_DOWN-N NOTES: Added by Julia for Lorelei.

example.name: bear_down-v
example.text: Moreover, they-1 could not secure enough force strength *PRO*-1 to bear down on feudal lords, so they had to allow feudal lords to continuously rule their domains.

roleset.name: approach in a determined manner (possibly from windward)
roleset.note: BEAR_DOWN-V, BEARING_DOWN-N NOTES: Added by Julia for Lorelei.

example.name: bear_down-v
example.text: Officials in Taiwan braced for the worst Thursday, as a howling, screaming super typhoon bore down on the island nation.

roleset.name: create a hole
roleset.note: BORE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bore' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 21.2-2, Framenet entry Experiencer obj. Note that those refer to different rolesets. (from bore.01-v predicate notes)

BORED-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Verbnet entry 21.2-2. Framed by Claire. I'm not actually certain that this can come up as an adj, but given the difficulty in distinguishing verbs, adjectives in English... Differs from verb frame in that instrument and cause don't seem grammatically separable for adjective. (from bored.01-j)

example.name: bore-v: two of four
example.text: [A worm]-2 resides in the operating system of a computer and spreads by *trace*-2 boring into other computers contacted through networks.
example.arg: into other computers contacted through networks

example.name: bore-v: all args
example.text: John bored holes in Mary's coffee table with a power drill.

example.name: bored-j: All args
example.text: A few leaves are also missing in the middle of the manuscript and most of the remaining ones are bored with holes by insects.

roleset.name: be dull, experiencing boredom
roleset.note: BORE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bore' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 21.2-2, Framenet entry Experiencer obj. Note that those refer to different rolesets. (from bore.02-v predicate notes)

BORED-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. Differs from verb frame because it doesn't have args 2 (instrument) or 3 (intensifier), as neither of these seem grammatically possible with adjective. (from bored.02-j)

BORING-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. Differs from verb frame because it doesn't have args 2 (instrument) or 3 (intensifier), as neither of these seem grammatically possible with adjective. (from boring.01-j)

roles.note: arg3 added by Julia to accommodate instance in BOLT, based on comparison to 'scare-v.01'. (from bore.02-v) arg3 added by Julia to accommodate instance in BOLT, based on comparison to 'scare-v.01'. (from bored.02-j)

example.name: bore-v: all args (minus 3)
example.text: John bored his dinner guests with stories of his adventures in Peoria.
example.arg: with stories of his adventures in Peoria

example.name: bore-v: arg3
example.text: Somilian pirates / mexican drug cartels would bore the hell out of me .

example.name: boring-j
example.text: A San Francisco lawyer, Mr. Panelli rowed religiously when he first got the machine, but, he complains, it left grease marks on his carpet, ``and it was boring.

example.name: boring-j: Arg 0 only
example.text: this year I 'd love a gravy separator and a new set of barbecue tools , but apparently these are " too boring " , so I will be getting a surprise instead ...

example.name: boring-j: With It EXP
example.text: Ettore would say it was boring to have a normal house, you have to change things around all the time.

example.name: boring-j: All args
example.text: I observed many kids rushing just because they hated the work and it was boring to them and they didn't really care about getting it right.

example.name: bored-j: All arguments
example.text: But she was bored with him and ended the relationship.

example.name: bored-j: agent and experiencer
example.text: Eventually viewers may grow bored with the technology and resent the cost.

example.name: bored-j: Arg 1 only
example.text: If you 're bored I 'm sure you could match people from the pics in the OP to the pics taken by closed circuit security cams during the Stanley Cup riot recently .

example.name: bored-j: experiencer
example.text: Mr. Azoff reportedly was bored and frequently clashed with top MCA management over a number of issues such as compensation and business plans.
